capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures over the trailing twelve months for fiscal year 2025

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased nearly 1 million shares for a total of $150 million in Q2 2025

dividends.context: Declared a quarterly dividend of $0.40 per share, paid $4.4 billion over the last 12 months

Fusion_and_Autonomous_Database.description: Continued growth and advancements in Fusion ERP, Fusion HCM, and the Autonomous Database
initiatives: Upgrading legacy systems to Fusion ERP and Fusion HCM
Expanding the Autonomous Database customer base
Enhancing security and reducing human error with autonomous technologies
Integrating Oracle MySQL with Heat Wave across multiple public clouds
Making Oracle MySQL with HeatWave available on other public clouds
Launching new cloud-based applications for banking and healthcare
Developing cloud-based National Electronic Health Records (EHR) Database and Public Health Management Applications
goals: Become the largest back-office applications provider
Increase recurring revenue through cloud services
Prevent data theft and reduce operational costs with autonomous technologies
Achieve widespread adoption of Oracle MySQL with Heat Wave
Expand OCI capacity to meet growing demand
Enhance cloud portfolio with edge infrastructure and health management solutions
examples: Bank of America going live on Oracle Fusion ERP
Macquarie, the largest investment bank in Australia, going live with Oracle Fusion ERP
Vanguard going live with Oracle Fusion ERP
Strategic partnerships with HSBC, Bank New York Mellon, JPMorgan Chase
Development of new cloud B2B financing and payment systems with banking partners

Autonomous_Database.description: Introduction and expansion of Oracle Autonomous Database as a game changer in cloud services
initiatives: Automating database configuration, patching, backup, and encryption
Preventing human error to enhance data security
Promoting Autonomous Database to non-Oracle customers
Integrating Autonomous Database with other Oracle Cloud services
Making Oracle MySQL with Heat Wave available on multiple public clouds
Adding OCI capacity and building new data centers
Launching Oracle Database 21c with over 200 new features
Expanding Oracle Roving Edge Infrastructure for secure, scalable cloud services in remote areas
goals: Differentiate second-generation cloud from first-generation cloud
Reduce operational costs by eliminating human labor
Prevent data theft and catastrophic data loss
Achieve widespread adoption across various industries
Compete aggressively with Amazon Aurora, Redshift, and Snowflake
Ensure scalable infrastructure to support growing demand
Reinforce Oracle's converged database strategy with Oracle Database 21c
examples: Oracle MySQL with HeatWave available on Oracle Public Cloud and other public clouds
Customers measuring Oracle's MySQL to be 100x faster than Amazon Aurora for query processing
Oracle MySQL with HeatWave outperforming Amazon Aurora and Redshift
Snowflake's competitive data warehouse solutions being outperformed by Oracle's offerings

MultiCloud_Partnerships.description: Expanded cooperation with Microsoft, Google, and AWS to enhance cloud offerings
initiatives: Signed a MultiCloud agreement with AWS, integrating Exadata hardware and Version 23ai database software into AWS cloud datacenters
Expanded Oracle Cloud regions in Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud
Signed an agreement with Meta to use Oracle's AI Cloud Infrastructure and collaborate on AI Agents based on Meta's Llama models
goals: Enhance Oracle's competitive positioning in the cloud market
Provide customers with flexible cloud deployment options
Turbocharge the growth of Oracle's database business
Enable customers to use Oracle databases across multiple hyperscalers seamlessly
examples: Oracle Database available within AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud
Collaboration with Meta on Llama models using Oracle's AI Cloud Infrastructure

AI_Driven_Growth.description: Significant demand for AI large language model training driving record-level sales and increased RPO
initiatives: Training AI models on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with NVIDIA GPUs
Delivering the world's largest and fastest AI supercomputer scaling up to 65,000 NVIDIA H200 GPUs
Embedding AI agents in cloud applications to automate various business processes
goals: Maintain leadership in AI workload infrastructure
Expand AI-driven revenue streams
Enhance the scalability and performance of AI training capabilities
examples: Signing over 30 AI contracts totaling more than $12.5 billion
Training generative AI models like ChatGPT, Grok, and Llama
AI agents automating tasks such as drug design, image analysis, and fraud detection

GPU_Contracts.description: Record-level GPU consumption driving Infrastructure business growth
initiatives: Scaling AI supercomputers with NVIDIA GPUs
Signing additional GPU contracts to meet AI training demand
goals: Support large-scale AI model training
Provide cost-effective and high-performance GPU resources
Stay competitive against other hyperscalers in the AI infrastructure space
examples: Delivered the world's largest and fastest AI supercomputer with 65,000 NVIDIA H200 GPUs
Signed 42 additional cloud GPU contracts totaling $3 billion in Q2 2025

revenue_growth.expectation: Healthy bookings growth with continued demand for hybrid and cloud offerings
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to grow between 7% to 9% in Q2 2025
revenue_growth.fx_impact: Currency should have minimal effect on total revenue and EPS in Q2
factors: Growth in Oracle Cloud consumption and long-term contracts
Accelerating growth rate expected to continue fiscal year 2025
Expansion of OCI capacity to meet growing demand
Continued adoption of Fusion ERP and NetSuite ERP

eps_growth.context: Non-GAAP EPS growth in constant currency and USD, adjusted for currency headwind

drivers: Investments in GitHub and Citus Data acquisitions
Continued investment in AI and commercial sales capacity
Aggressive investment in OCI capacity and data center expansion

focus: Development of Oracle Roving Edge Infrastructure

revenue_growth.range: 9% to 11% in constant currency, 7% to 9% in USD
revenue_growth.context: Total revenues are expected to grow 9% to 11% in constant currency and 7% to 9% in USD for Q3 2025

cloud_revenue_growth.range: 25% to 27% in constant currency, 23% to 25% in USD
cloud_revenue_growth.context: Total cloud revenue is expected to grow 25% to 27% in constant currency and 23% to 25% in USD for Q3 2025

non_gaap_eps_growth.range: 7% to 9% in constant currency, 4% to 6% in USD
non_gaap_eps_growth.context: Non-GAAP EPS is expected to grow between 7% to 9% in constant currency ($1.50 to $1.54) and 4% to 6% in USD ($1.47 to $1.51) for Q3 2025

currency_impact.description: Currency should have a 1% positive effect on revenue and a $0.03 positive effect on EPS in Q3
currency_impact.context: Assuming currency exchange rates remain the same as they are now

metadata.source: Fiscal 2025 Q2 Earnings Call Transcript and Press Release
operating_environment_challenges: Impact of COVID-19 on global operations
Currency fluctuations affecting revenue and EPS
Scaling cloud infrastructure to meet growing demand
Ensuring data security with Autonomous Database
Capacity constraints in OCI leading to rapid expansion
Competition with other cloud providers like AWS, Microsoft, and Google
Maintaining high customer retention rates amidst aggressive growth
